justification: The article states that Step 1 will use "validated questionnaires: e.g. MCAI (Schraw & Dennison, 1994)", immediately after naming Meta-Cognitive Awareness as one of the traits to be measured.
Under Step 1 the authors list "SRQ (Aubrey et al., 1994)" among the instruments selected to measure the trait Self-Regulation previously identified for assessment.
The same sentence includes "REQ (Gross & John, 2003)"—the Emotion Regulation Questionnaire—indicating it will be used to assess participants’ emotion-regulation capacities.
Perspective Taking is listed as a key individual trait, and the authors note that they will employ "IRI (Davis, 1983)"—whose Perspective-Taking subscale operationalises this construct.
To capture Communication Styles, the paper specifies using the "CIS (de Vries et al., 2013)" as part of the Step 1 questionnaire battery.
Motivational structure is one of the five targeted traits, and the authors list "SIMS (Guay et al., 2002)" as the instrument to measure this dimension.
